newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: EU real farm prices little changed in 1995.
newsitem.headline: EU real farm prices little changed in 1995.

text.p: The index of agricultural producer prices in the European Union rose in 1995 almost equal to inflation leaving real prices almost unchanged, Eurostat, the EU statistical office said in a report on Wednesday.
The index for the EU-15 (excluding the former East Germany) rose in nominal terms by four percent, it said.
"This increase was nearly equal to the rate of inflation and so the real agricultural price index was almost unchanged (at +3.0 percent), the report said.
Stability in agricultural prices seen in 1994 continued but the real index which was 100 in 1990 was only 85.6 in 1995.
The real price for crop products rose sharply by 4.7 per cent in 1995, after real price declines in 1993 and 1992.
The real price index for animals and animal products declined by 3.8 per cent continuing the downward trend of recent years.
A rise of 3.1 percent in real input prices was almost equal to inflation leaving the real input price index little changed at -0.2 percent, the report said.
